comment:
ISA 4330- Incident Response and Disaster Relief.
Good guy and very interesting information. Open notes for quizzes and exams. Took this in the summer and ran through super fast. Three HW's, make sure to do them!

Had professor Zafar for an online Summer course for IS8330, and he made the course pretty straight forward, provided plenty of time to complete, and submit assignments. Discussion board relevant to course work, and really made you think. Great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This is an online course. The only things that matter are professor responsiveness in a timely manner and timely assistance with labs. It took weeks to get help with one or two basic questions. He deflected responsibility as a rule. When he did finally get to me, it was clear he was not familiar with how to proceed with the lab. BAD!
Very hard class but he does deal with computers, overall he is very helpful and lets you turn in late work for some points , he replies to emails kind of slow but over all great teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is a brilliant professor who has his CISSP and is very gifted in the field. You must attend class to complete the in-class labs and runs on the honor system where at the end of class if you tell him it's done or have it done by next class you get a 100 for that lab. I am not a coder but studied alot and did all of my assignments and got an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Super easy. He doesn't care about your grade so much as if you know the content. Attendance is somewhat mandatory since you do in-class labs which consist of coding challenges, but you can work with other students. Again, he only cares that you learn the stuff and collaborating with other developers is a real-life scenario. Tests verbatim from book

This professor was very cool. He admitted to teaching this course for the first time online. All you have to do is post discussions and respond to other posts. There are 2 tests and 1 major 10 page paper in APA format. I like his class and his willing to help you with anything in his course. I would love to take him again. A++++++

Good professor. Crystal clear and has a sense of humor. His assignments are challenging only if you don't dedicate time to learn the language. Guess what, you're in college. Deal with it, study hard and be successful or become a OWS protestor.
Ridiculously gifted programming professor. Can figure out most errors without looking!! But the class is tough...so you need to show up. Has novel ideas for extra credit points.

Funny guy but can be rather arrogant. Very smart instructor and straightforward class. I enjoyed the class, but you have to be resourceful, because he expects you to prepare alot of the applications yourself.

Great professor, great class. Have to show up there's a quiz and lab each class which is a big part of your grade. 4 Exams, non-comprehensive. He is interactive, good sense of humor and solicits student discussions with good jokes, and question to make you think... Great Prof! Take him if you actually want to learn. Finally a decent IS prof. @ KSU
